meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of being classical.
meanings.sent1: Her dance performance showcased the classicality of her movements.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting displayed a perfect blend of modernity and classicality.
meanings.sent3: The classicality of his taste in music made him a hit at the retirement home dance party.
meanings.sent4: The classicality of the ancient architecture stood as a testament to the enduring beauty of the past.
meanings.sent5: The classicality of the melody lingered in the air long after the concert ended.

meanings.definition: The adherence to traditional or established standards or principles.
meanings.sent1: The team's success was attributed to their classicality in following the coach's strategies.
meanings.sent2: In a world of constant change, her classicality in values was a rare and admirable trait.
meanings.sent3: His classicality in always wearing a suit and tie even to the beach made him the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The company's classicality in customer service set them apart from their competitors.
meanings.sent5: The classicality of her handwriting reflected the elegance of a bygone era.
